sub_topic: Finding the Ramsey number of a graph.
message_1: What is the Ramsey number R(3,3) for a complete graph?
message_2: The Ramsey number R(3,3) for a complete graph is 6. This means that in any group of 6 people, there will always be either a group of 3 people who all know each other (forming a complete subgraph of order 3) or a group of 3 people who are all strangers to each other (forming an independent set of order 3).
